item.title: Joann add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The highest function of love is that it makes the loved one a unique and irreplaceable being." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Joann add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Joann add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "One is happy once one knows the necessary ingredients of happiness: simple tastes, a certain degree of courage, self denial to a point, love of work, and above all, a clear conscience." -- George Sand

item.title: Joann add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Always try to keep a patch of sky above your life." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Joann add a quote by William Makepeace Thackeray
item.description: "Good humor may be said to be one of the very best articles of dress one can wear in society." -- William Makepeace Thackeray

item.title: Joann add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Joann add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Joann add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Ah, good taste! What a dreadful thing! Taste is the enemy of creativeness." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Joann add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Joann add a quote by Ted Hughes
item.description: "The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all." -- Ted Hughes

item.title: Joann add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Joann add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Joann add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I am reading six books at once, the only way of reading; since, as you will agree, one book is only a single unaccompanied note, and to get the full sound, one needs ten others at the same time." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Joann add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Joann add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Every reader, as he reads, is actually the reader of himself. The writer's work is only a kind of optical instrument he provides the reader so he can discern what he might never have seen in himself without this book. The reader's recognition in himself of what the book says is the proof of the book's truth." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Joann add a quote by Francois Mauriac
item.description: "If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads." -- Francois Mauriac

item.title: Joann add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...But I am too busy thinking about myself." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Joann add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Curiosity is, in great and generous minds, the first passion and the last." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Joann add a quote by Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
item.description: "Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire." -- Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.title: Joann add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Joann add a quote by Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
item.description: "To be content with little is difficult; to be content with much, impossible." -- Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

item.title: Joann add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Joann add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "He was mastered by the sheer surging of life, the tidal wave of being, the perfect joy of each separate muscle, joint, and sinew in that it was everything that was not death, that it was aglow and rampant, expressing itself in movement, flying exultantly under the stars." -- Jack London

item.title: Joann add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "I will take the sun in my mouth and leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyes to dash against darkness" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Joann add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Joann add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Everybody has a secret world inside of them. I mean everybody. All of the people in the whole world, I mean everybody — no matter how dull and boring they are on the outside. Inside them they've all got unimaginable, magnificent, wonderful, stupid, amazing worlds... Not just one world. Hundreds of them. Thousands, maybe." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Joann add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Talking nonsense is the sole privilege mankind possesses over the other organisms. It's by talking nonsense that one gets to the truth! I talk nonsense, therefore I'm human" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Joann add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking." -- George S. Patton

item.title: Joann add a quote by Howard Thurman
item.description: "Whatever may be the tensions and the stresses of a particular day, there is always lurking close at hand the trailing beauty of forgotten joy or unremembered peace." -- Howard Thurman

item.title: Joann add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "To see a World in a Grain of Sand And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand And Eternity in an hour." -- William Blake
